DOC.brief_title: Clinical Study Biosilicate Under Resin Composite Restorations Caries Affected Teeth
DOC.detailed_description: Background : Dental caries decrease recent year , still main oral health problem develop undeveloped industrialized country . The purpose study evaluate clinical performance resin-based composite Class I II restoration association Biosilicate . Methods : Eighty patient carious lesion receive restoration premolar molar , randomly allocate four experimental group : G1 ( Biosilicate , AdperSingle Bond 2 IPS Empress Direct composite ) , G2 ( Adper Single Bond 2 IPS Empress Direct composite ) , G3 ( Biosilicate , AdheSe IPS Empress Direct composite ) e G4 ( AdheSE IPS Empress Direct composite ) — ( n= 20 per group ) . To participate clinical trial , qualified subject must meet inclusion exclusion criterion . Sixty-four ( 64 ) select volunteer fully inform nature study sign Term Acceptance define Ethics Committee ( FORP - USP ) , invited participate . Carious teeth clean pumice-water slurry rubber cup remove salivary pellicle bacterial plaque . As much possible , local anesthesia . After caries removal ( high low-speed handpieces abundant water irrigation ) , patient allocate randomly four experimental group cite . Final contour polish restoration perform appointment , use fine-grit diamond bur ( KG Sorensen ) , silicon carbide polisher ( Viking Kit , KG Sorensen ) , silicone rubber tip ( Viking Kit , KG Sorensen ) flexible disc ( Sof-Lex , 3M ESPE ) , polish paste ( Diamond Excel , FGM ) . Two train calibrated evaluator , fully blind restorative technique use , evaluate restoration baseline ( one week placement restoration ) , 06 , 12 18 month use FDI criterion . All restoration photograph every evaluation point . Esthetic , Functional Biological propriety use key parameter determine overall clinical success . Data analyze .
DOC.criteria: Cavitated noncavitated active carious lesion dentin ( Class I and/or II ) Carious lesion teeth without restoration least one tooth ( upper low premolar and/or molar ) . No history spontaneous pain Pulp vital test positive No evidence periapical radiolucency Compromised medical history Periodontal disease Pulp necrosis Absence antagonist teeth Severe bruxism Active orthodontic treatment Teeth crack premature contact . Pregnancy
